episodes.title: 273 - Doris Salcedo. Atrabilious. 1992-93.
episodes.author: MoMA, The Museum of Modern Art
episodes.summary: Wall installation with plywood, shoes, animal fiber, thread, and sheepskin, six niches. Overall 30 x 70 1/4 x 5 1/8" (76.2 x 178.4 x 13 cm). Gift of Marie-Josée and Henry R. Kravis. © 2012 Doris Salcedo. Audio courtesy of Acoustiguide.

episodes.title: 276 - Andrea Zittel. Lavender Corduroy Personal Panel. 1995-98.
episodes.author: MoMA, The Museum of Modern Art
episodes.summary: Multiple of corduroy fabric with elastic. Overall: 45 x 28" (114.3 x 71.1 cm). Publisher: Andrea Zittel. Edition: ongoing. Gift of the artist, through Andrea Rosen Gallery, New York. © 2012 Andrea Zittel. Audio courtesy of Acoustiguide.

episodes.title: 275 - Andrea Zittel. Wall Sprawl (Next to Las Vegas Bay). 2008.
episodes.author: MoMA, The Museum of Modern Art
episodes.summary: Multiple of wallpaper, dimensions vary. Gift of the artist, through Andrea Rosen Gallery, New York. © 2012 Andrea Zittel. Audio courtesy of Acoustiguide.

episodes.title: 274 - Andrea Zittel. A-Z Escape Vehicle: Customized by Andrea Zittel. 1996.
episodes.author: MoMA, The Museum of Modern Art
episodes.summary: Exterior: steel, insulation, wood and glass. Interior: colored lights, water, fiberglass, wood, papier-mâché, pebbles and paint. 62" x 7' x 40" (157.5 x 213.3 x 101.6 cm). The Norman and Rosita Winston Foundation, Inc. Fund and an anonymous fund. © 2012 Andrea Zittel. Audio courtesy of Acoustiguide.

episodes.title: 211 - Robert Heinecken. Surrealism on TV. 1986
episodes.author: MoMA, The Museum of Modern Art
episodes.summary: 35mm color slides, silent, time variable The Robert Heinecken Trust, Chicago © The Robert Heinecken Trust

episodes.title: 212 - Robert Heinecken. Shiva Manifesting as a Single Mother. 1989
episodes.author: MoMA, The Museum of Modern Art
episodes.summary: Magazine paper, paint, and varnish Collection Philip F. Denny, Chicago © The Robert Heinecken Trust

episodes.title: 209 - Robert Heinecken. Lessons in Posing Subjects / Matching Facial Expressions. 1981
episodes.author: MoMA, The Museum of Modern Art
episodes.summary: Internal dye diffusion transfer prints (SX-70 Polaroid) and lithographic text on Rives BFK paper Collection UCLA Grunwald Center for Graphic Art, Hammer Museum, Los Angeles Gift of Dean Valentine and Amy Adelson © The Robert Heinecken Trust

episodes.title: 210 - Robert Heinecken. Inaugural Excerpt Videograms. 1981 (detail)
episodes.author: MoMA, The Museum of Modern Art
episodes.summary: Silver dye bleach prints Whitney Museum of American Art, New York. Purchase, with funds from the Photography © The Robert Heinecken Trust

episodes.title: 215 - Robert Heinecken. The SS Copyright Project: “On Photography”. 1978
episodes.author: MoMA, The Museum of Modern Art
episodes.summary: Collage of black and white instant prints attached to composite board with staples The Museum of Modern Art, New York. Purchased as the partial gift of Celeste Bartos © The Robert Heinecken Trust

episodes.title: 203 - Robert Heinecken. Fractured Figure Sections. 1967
episodes.author: MoMA, The Museum of Modern Art
episodes.summary: Gelatin silver prints on wood blocks The Museum of Modern Art, New York The Photography Council Fund and Committee on Photography Fund © The Robert Heinecken Trust

episodes.title: 214 - Robert Heinecken. Figure Horizon #1. 1971
episodes.author: MoMA, The Museum of Modern Art
episodes.summary: Canvas panels with photographic emulsion The Museum of Modern Art, New York. Gift of Shirley C. Burden, by exchange © The Robert Heinecken Trust

episodes.title: 206 - Robert Heinecken. TV / Time Environment. 1970/2014
episodes.author: MoMA, The Museum of Modern Art
episodes.summary: Original black-and-white transparency, facsimile of Periodical #5, and recreated living room arrangement Transparency: Center for Creative Photography, University of Arizona, Tucson Robert Heinecken Archive. Gift of the artist © The Robert Heinecken Trust

episodes.title: 205 - Robert Heinecken. Periodical #5. 1971
episodes.author: MoMA, The Museum of Modern Art
episodes.summary: Offset lithography on found magazine Collection Philip Aarons and Shelley Fox Aarons, New York © The Robert Heinecken Trust

episodes.summary: Gelatin silver print Collection Jeffrey Leifer, San Francisco © The Robert Heinecken Trust

episodes.summary: Gelatin silver print Collection Geofrey and Laura Wyatt, Santa Barbara, California © The Robert Heinecken Trust

episodes.title: 200 - Introduction to Robert Heinecken: Object Matter
